sentences: Mina olen juba keeratud oma m천tete l천kkeks.
Ta proovis laua maha keerata, kuid see ei t천estanud.
context: 'keerata' in Estonian primarily means to twist or spin something physically. It can also be used metaphorically to mean confusing someone or making a situation complicated. Common usage includes describing the action of twisting objects, spinning things around, or situations where confusion arises.
